commit_message:
Add free5GC VNF samples

As the current Tacker only provides a limited number of sample VNFs,
this patch adds free5GC VNF samples for the operation verification,
which corresponds to ETSI NFV Plugtests Conformance testing.

This patch includes the following VNF packages.

- VNF
  - VNF base
  - ChangeExtConn
  - Anti-Affinity
- CNF
- CNF on VM
  - CNF
  - VNF

Change-Id: I87f8dfc9d5d7f9f83e28016132b11470700bdb02
Implements: blueprint free5gc-vnf-samples
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/28/812628/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: description: Sample VNF imports: - etsi_nfv_sol001_common_types.yaml - etsi_nfv_sol001_vnfd_types.yaml - free5gc_types.yaml - free5gc_df_simple.yaml topology_template: inputs: selected_flavour: description: VNF deployment flavour selected by the consumer. It is provided in the API type: string node_templates: VNF: properties: descriptor_id: a8bb9888-7c63-4293-a95e-2ef102ae1d3a descriptor_version: '1.0' flavour_id: get_input: selected_flavour product_name: Sample VNF provider: Company software_version: '1.0' vnfm_info: - Tacker requirements: null type: company.provider.VNF tosca_definitions_version: tosca_simple_yaml_1_2

subject: Disable Neutron firewall
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-05 09:46:59.000000000', 'files': ['zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/3d18075fb42911c0d4a8a1737708c6a5393b4b7a', 'message': "Disable Neutron firewall

Neutron's firewall initialization with OVS seems
to be the source of our pain with ports not being found
by ironic jobs. This is because firewall startup errors
crashes out the agent with a RuntimeError while it is deep
in it's initial __init__ sequence.

This ultimately seems to be rooted with communication
with OVS itself, but perhaps the easiest solution is
to just disable the firewall....

Related: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1944201
Change-Id: I303989a825a7e35f1cb7b401134fd63553f6791c
(cherry picked from commit 8e173b88d138d0065e7f1bc668e3a0b65ce3be2e)
"}]
commit_message:
Disable Neutron firewall

Neutron's firewall initialization with OVS seems
to be the source of our pain with ports not being found
by ironic jobs. This is because firewall startup errors
crashes out the agent with a RuntimeError while it is deep
in it's initial __init__ sequence.

This ultimately seems to be rooted with communication
with OVS itself, but perhaps the easiest solution is
to just disable the firewall....

Related: https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1944201
Change-Id: I303989a825a7e35f1cb7b401134fd63553f6791c
(cherry picked from commit 8e173b88d138d0065e7f1bc668e3a0b65ce3be2e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/37/812437/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(TheJulia): Disable neutron firewall as bug # https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1944201 # causes us an abnormally high job failure rate due to the ports # not being found (as neutron crashed on initailization). Q_USE_SECGROUP: False

commit_message:
Enable keystone_authtoken/memcach_use_advanced_pool for Sahara

Sahara was removed during Wallaby cycle and because of that it was not
updated when commit 09bcacd25a7217ce66eec10ccfda4847e6d3d87a was
backported from Wallaby to Victoria.
This change updates the Sahara templates to have consistent definition
with the other services.

Related-Bug: #1931047
Change-Id: Idb9a209b2651c1ff03c3ccaa14f4976a9f267e99
(cherry picked from commit 59599a86d7cd69240195f4455d8fe5e76c9ace51)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/08/806908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: MemcacheUseAdvancedPool: type: boolean description: | Use the advanced (eventlet safe) memcached client pool. default: true sahara::keystone::authtoken::memcache_use_advanced_pool: {get_param: MemcacheUseAdvancedPool}

commit_message:
policy: correct domain_id match for admin_and_matching_domain_id

Ensure that the 'admin_and_matching_domain_id' rule correct
matches to the target.domain_id field, ensuring that domain
admins can actually query user and projects within a domain.

Change-Id: I4c000363dd7746f401613d99210e8ca12f34b010
Closes-Bug: 1830076

commit_message:
Add accepted formats on 'key' configuration

Add a bit more information on config.yaml about the type of keys
that can be passed as a parameter to the 'key' configuration.

Signed-off-by: David Negreira <david.negreira@canonical.com>
Change-Id: Ieeb0f598ca9a7188f81619c2b4fe88af14f260fd
Closes-Bug: #1942605
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd refs/changes/11/807311/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The accepted formats should be a GPG key in ASCII armor format, including BEGIN and END markers or a keyid.

commit_message:
Disable expose_image_locations whenever S3 is enabled

This is a follow-up change on Id2e9d4351513341b5ee41fa8a8d677aca6580fca
Instead of relying users to set expose-image-locations=false which is
error prone, disable expose_image_locations from the charm side whenever
S3 backend is enabled not to expose credentials.

Closes-Bug: 1935743
Change-Id: Iac0f27418eec6c818df8cc3fa1c133db38d26069
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-glance refs/changes/23/800323/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: S3 server information can be passed via charm config options, and enabling S3 backend overrides `expose-image-locations` as false not to expose S3 credentials through Glance API.
deleted_lines: S3 server information can be passed via charm config options, and you must set `expose-image-locations` as false not to expose S3 credentials through Glance API. expose-image-locations=false \

commit_message:
Fix typos in ec2 credential policies

There was a trailing s in two of these policies and it caused the policy
names to mismatch, which causes confusion with the rendered policy files
and potentially causes uses with deprecation logic.

Change-Id: I54021986d17c57d7733d53caa4032c2767eaf25e

commit_message:
Fix typos in application credential policies

We updated these policies when we introduces system scope and default
roles, but the policy names accidentally changed, which makes the policy
files render with an alias because oslo.policy thinks the names are
changing.

Change-Id: I1121f1abe769ee83ffc285103a95ee95540ce727

commit_message:
Add xena bundles

- add non-voting focal-xena bundle
- add non-voting impish-xena bundle
- rebuild to pick up charm-helpers changes
- update tox/pip.sh to ensure setuptools<50.0.0

Change-Id: I2586f92b458a79d4efc9d7ccb12e5a986c959dfd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone-ldap refs/changes/05/811105/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTES: # * We avoid the new dependency resolver by pinning pip < 20.3, see # https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/9187 # * Pinning dependencies requires tox >= 3.2.0, see # https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-requires # * It is also necessary to pin virtualenv as a newer virtualenv would still # lead to fetching the latest pip in the func* tox targets, see # https://stackoverflow.com/a/38133283 requires = pip < 20.3 virtualenv < 20.0 setuptools<50.0.0 # NOTE: https://wiki.canonical.com/engineering/OpenStack/InstallLatestToxOnOsci minversion = 3.18.0 {toxinidir}/pip.sh install {opts} {packages}

.htaccess file incorrect, leaving the redirects broken. Fix the
redirects to properly redirect to the new targets.

subject: Revert "Replace dstat with pcp-dstat"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-09-08 19:21:14.000000000', 'files': ['files/debs/dstat'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/52a563834bfaf3c268480ccad4711677584bd43c', 'message': 'Revert "Replace dstat with pcp-dstat"

This reverts commit c19c1262c8b81f1cc543eafb9e5c3a34c4b632fe.

The pcp package fails to install on ubuntu fairly regularly due to a
timeout starting the pmlogger.service unit. It seems there have been
bugs for this in fedora [0] and while that bug notes a fix was
upstreamed that fix does not seem to be sufficient.

You can see the occurence of these failures by querying logstash for:

  message:"pmlogger.service failed because a timeout was exceeded." AND filename:"job-output.txt"

I'm pushing this change to start some conversation about the problem. If
we don't want to revert we should probably add a devstack bug for this
issue and an e-r entry to track it.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1721223

commit_message:
Revert "Replace dstat with pcp-dstat"

This reverts commit c19c1262c8b81f1cc543eafb9e5c3a34c4b632fe.

The pcp package fails to install on ubuntu fairly regularly due to a
timeout starting the pmlogger.service unit. It seems there have been
bugs for this in fedora [0] and while that bug notes a fix was
upstreamed that fix does not seem to be sufficient.

You can see the occurence of these failures by querying logstash for:

  message:"pmlogger.service failed because a timeout was exceeded." AND filename:"job-output.txt"

I'm pushing this change to start some conversation about the problem. If
we don't want to revert we should probably add a devstack bug for this
issue and an e-r entry to track it.

[0] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1721223

Change-Id: I657e802805db6835693e6b811799b189a71bec0d

commit_message:
Add operation: Set up admin access to a cloud

Add a cloud operation showing how to gain control of a
Juju-deployed OpenStack cloud.

Change-Id: I88ae10e79535b830a770be902b0d65830fd913fa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-deployment-guide refs/changes/64/806064/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :orphan: ====================================== Gain administrative control of a cloud ====================================== Preamble -------- In order to configure a newly deployed OpenStack cloud for production use one must first gain native administrative control of it. Although this refers to OpenStack-level admin user access, this article will show how to obtain it via queries made with the Juju client. Procedure --------- Install the client software ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The OpenStack clients will be needed in order to manage the cloud from the command line. Install them on the same machine that hosts the Juju client. This example uses the snap install method: .. code-block:: none sudo snap install openstackclients --classic Obtain primary authentication information ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ In terms of authentication, three primary pieces of information are needed: * the Keystone administrator password * the Keystone service endpoint * the root CA certificate (if the cloud is TLS-enabled) Keystone administrator password ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Set the Keystone administrator password to the well-known OS_PASSWORD environmental variable: .. code-block:: none export OS_PASSWORD=$(juju run --unit keystone/leader 'leader-get admin_passwd') Keystone service endpoint ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Determine the IP address of the keystone unit and then set the Keystone service endpoint to the well-known OS_AUTH_URL environmental variable: .. code-block:: none IP_ADDRESS=$(juju run --unit keystone/leader -- 'network-get --bind-address public') OS_AUTH_URL=https://${IP_ADDRESS}:5000/v3 .. important:: If the Keystone endpoint is not using TLS you will need to modify the URL to use HTTP. Root CA certificate ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Place the CA certificate in a file that your OpenStack client software can access. Set the file name to the well-known OS_CACERT environmental variable. Since this example uses the ``openstackclients`` snap the file will be ``/home/ubuntu/snap/openstackclients/common/root-ca.crt`` (for user 'ubuntu'): .. code-block:: none export OS_CACERT=/home/ubuntu/snap/openstackclients/common/root-ca.crt juju run --unit vault/leader 'leader-get root-ca' > $OS_CACERT Verify administrative control ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ .. code-block:: console Consider a helper script ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This information can be most easily obtained by using files created and maintained for this purpose. They can be found in the `openstack-bundles`_ repository. Download the repository and source the ``openrc`` file: .. code-block:: none git clone https://github.com/openstack-charmers/openstack-bundles ~/openstack-bundles source ~/openstack-bundles/stable/openstack-base/openrc The admin user environment should also now be set up. Verify this: .. code-block:: none env | grep OS_ Sample output: .. code-block:: console OS_REGION_NAME=RegionOne OS_AUTH_VERSION=3 OS_CACERT=/home/ubuntu/snap/openstackclients/common/root-ca.crt OS_AUTH_URL=https://10.0.0.162:5000/v3 OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME=admin_domain OS_AUTH_PROTOCOL=https OS_USERNAME=admin OS_AUTH_TYPE=password OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME=admin_domain OS_PROJECT_NAME=admin OS_PASSWORD=aegoaquoo1veZae6 OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=3 .. note:: The helper file will set the Keystone endpoint variable ``OS_AUTH_URL`` to use HTTPS if Vault is detected as containing a root CA certificate. This will always be the case due to the OVN requirement for TLS via Vault. If Keystone is not TLS-enabled (for some reason) you will need to manually reset the above variable to use HTTP.

commit_message:
Add balancer module support for 'upmap'

This allows the user to change the configuration parameter
'balancer-mode' via Juju in order to set the balancer mode for Ceph.

Change-Id: I60dbd5f163e0c9d004275eff65db7ada41ad2660
Closes-Bug: #1888914
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-mon refs/changes/43/807943/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: balancer-upmap: type: boolean default: true description: | This configuration option sets the balancer mode used by Ceph. By default, or when set to 'true', it will use the 'upmap' mode (if supported); otherwise, it will use the 'crush-compat' mode.

commit_message:
Documenting test_list_servers_by_admin when VMs already exists

When running Tempest tests test_list_servers_by_admin
and test_list_servers_by_admin_with_specified_tenant
with VMs already spawned by an user or Admin user,
tests will fail because tests try to compare the result
with an empty list.

But the error message is not distinct and understandable.
(Currently: 'MismatchError: !=:')

Proposal to add a human error message, to help user to understand
the reason of the failure.

Change-Id: Iad30328c8319a7ac9d370f127103f5198201f3ee
Closes-bug: 1542425

commit_message:
Reseller-related test detects reseller support config

Only perform reseller-related setup (access ResellerAdmin role)
and run tests if reseller support is enabled in the config.

Closes-Bug: 1634233

Change-Id: I64ebc263a825f0006b241a07f3eee2a2cf912a6f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/48/387648/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import testtools reseller_enabled = CONF.identity_feature_enabled.reseller credentials = [['operator', CONF.object_storage.operator_role]] if cls.reseller_enabled: cls.os_reselleradmin = cls.os_roles_reseller if cls.reseller_enabled: cls.reselleradmin_auth_data = \ cls.os_reselleradmin.auth_provider.auth_data if self.reseller_enabled: self.credentials.append(['reseller', CONF.object_storage.reseller_admin_role]) self.account_client.auth_provider.set_alt_auth_data( request_part='headers', auth_data=self.reselleradmin_auth_data ) # Set a quota of 20 bytes on the user's account before each test headers = {"X-Account-Meta-Quota-Bytes": "20"} self.os.account_client.request("POST", url="", headers=headers, body="") if self.reseller_enabled: self.account_client.auth_provider.set_alt_auth_data( request_part='headers', auth_data=self.reselleradmin_auth_data ) # remove the quota from the container headers = {"X-Remove-Account-Meta-Quota-Bytes": "x"} self.os.account_client.request("POST", url="", headers=headers, body="") @testtools.skipUnless(CONF.identity_feature_enabled.reseller, 'Reseller not enabled.')

commit_message:
Add test_boot_with_low_disk in test_flavors_negative.py

Try to create server with flavor of insufficient disk size from that image.

Change-Id: If419cd9c7884fef36c348e2f0ac610d620e93110
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/70/447870/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test.attr(type=['negative']) @test.services('image') @decorators.idempotent_id('f9df7604-0e19-11e7-8906-fa163e199564') def test_boot_with_low_disk(self): """Try boot a vm with lower than min disk Create an image with min_disk value Try to create server with flavor of insufficient disk size from that image """ flavor = self.flavors_client.show_flavor( CONF.compute.flavor_ref)['flavor'] min_img_disk = flavor['disk'] + 1 size = random.randint(1024, 4096) image_file = six.BytesIO(data_utils.random_bytes(size)) params = { 'name': data_utils.rand_name('image'), 'container_format': CONF.image.container_formats[0], 'disk_format': CONF.image.disk_formats[0], 'min_disk': min_img_disk } if CONF.image_feature_enabled.api_v1: params.update({'is_public': False}) params = {'headers': common_image.image_meta_to_headers(**params)} else: params.update({'visibility': 'private'}) image = self.images_client.create_image(**params) image = image['image'] if 'image' in image else image self.addCleanup(self.images_client.delete_image, image['id']) if CONF.image_feature_enabled.api_v1: self.images_client.update_image(image['id'], data=image_file) else: self.images_client.store_image_file(image['id'], data=image_file) self.assertEqual(min_img_disk, image['min_disk']) self.assertRaisesRegexp(lib_exc.BadRequest, "Flavor's disk is smaller than the minimum " "size specified in image metadata", self.create_test_server, image_id=image['id'], flavor=flavor['id'])

commit_message:
Immutable user source: test_credentials

If the keystone user source is immutable, such as an LDAP
active directory implementation, tempest tests that create or
delete a user will fail. Instead of failing, we would like
them to skip. This change uses a class-level skip check
since each test in the class creates a user.
In [1], I introduced the config setting that allows
this to happen.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585536/

Change-Id: I7ac436b52f8d9d5a9871822e90efa60315c86c43
Partial-Bug: 1777047
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/78/587878/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest import configCONF = config.CONF def skip_checks(cls): super(CredentialsTestJSON, cls).skip_checks() if CONF.auth.immutable_user_source: raise cls.skipException('Environment has an immutable user source ' 'and does not support creating users.') @classmethod

commit_message:
Immutable user source: test_users_negative

If the keystone user source is immutable, such as an LDAP
active directory implementation, tempest tests that try
to create or delete a user will fail. Instead of failing,
we would like them to skip. This change uses a testtools
decorator to avoid unnecessary modifications and allow those tests
to skip. In [1], I introduced the config setting that allows
this to happen.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585536/

Change-Id: I776653884355d058e145979445f9ef5739417667
Partial-Bug: 1777047

commit_message:
Immutable user source: test_list_users

If the keystone user source is immutable, such as an LDAP
active directory implementation, tempest tests that try
to create or delete a user will fail. Instead of failing,
we would like them to skip. This change uses a class-level skip check
since each test in the class creates a user.
In [1], I introduced the config setting that allows
this to happen.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/585536/

Change-Id: I5db46b59586760c4f8b9152588c312743f37ae0f
Partial-Bug: 1777047
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/79/589279/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(UsersV3TestJSON, cls).skip_checks() if CONF.auth.immutable_user_source: # NOTE(anna.pankiewicz13): This flag is here because all tests # below rely on dynamic user creation in resource_setup. raise cls.skipException('Environment has an immutable user source ' 'and does not support creating users.')

Add NotAcceptable exception

This patch adds missed NotAcceptable exception and handle it
correctly by _error_checker() '

Change-Id: Ib9195ba86d7950f6a82812738b152b5c425fe170

commit_message:
Added check for valid region variable

Only update filtered_catalog if an endpoint with a matching region is found.
This stops the filtered_catalog variable being empty and overwritten
under the next conditional statement.

Change-Id: I63a9f054eeeadcba9a60b48252438f7240f73943
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/79/668479/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Filter by region only if the variable has a value if region: # Only update filtered_catalog if an endpoint with a matching region is found matching_region = [ep for ep in filtered_catalog if ep['region'] == region] if matching_region: filtered_catalog = matching_region
deleted_lines: # Filter by region filtered_catalog = [ep for ep in filtered_catalog if ep['region'] == region]

commit_message:
Add scenario of bootable encrypted volume

This is to add test to create bootable encrypted volume,
attach it to an instance, and last detach it.

Depends-On: I1265cc2af2acb1d950c7a944e607a9707d2f69e6
Change-Id: Ia51fc89cc743121fbe686406eb3a1685518476bd

'cryptsetup.LuksEncryptor', volume_type='luks', image=image) self.attach_detach_volume(server, volume) @test.idempotent_id('602aa6bc-8193-4186-b256-5f252736aa68') @test.services('compute', 'volume', 'image') def test_encrypted_bootable_cinder_volumes_cryptsetup(self): server = self.launch_instance() image = self.glance_image_create() volume = self.create_encrypted_volume('nova.volume.encryptors.' 'cryptsetup.CryptsetupEncryptor', volume_type='cryptsetup', image=image) self.attach_detach_volume(server, volume)

commit_message:
Update python version from 3.5 to 3.6 in setup.cfg

This updates the supported python version from 3.5 to
3.6 because OpenStack is moving toward 3.6 in general
so drop 3.5 in favor of 3.6.

Change-Id: I1ebcba8080430130bb3554c234a2f3fcf9be3870

added_lines: cfg.BoolOpt('live_resize', default=False, help="Does the test environment support live-resizing? When " "you enable this feature, 'flavor_ref_alt' should be set " "and it should refer to a larger flavor than the " "'flavor_ref' one and the image_ref Glance image must " "have the 'os_live_resize' metadata property containing " "the resources which will be upscaled: " "'disk, memory, vcpu'"),

subject: WIP: Add a test for detach/attach root volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-21 10:04:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/3f916a9f013eed7fefe3da3af3143ed6fc5928af', 'message': "Add a test for detach/attach root volume

This adds a compute API test for testing the detach and attach of root
volume for instance in shelved_offloaded state.

The Nova change allows to detach the root volume from a shelved offloaded
instance, the tempest test is testing the following path:
- boot an instance from volume
- shelve the instance
- verify that the detach of the root volume works
- verify that the unshelve of the instance fails as the instance doesn't
- have a root volume
- attach the root volume
- verify that the unshelve of the instance works correctly.

Change-Id: Iab442d2f180b6bc6b584e9e5c6fb1433399343df
Depends-On: I08d2dc8685484a39b6c92fa2e65b82ab93a0a7f6

commit_message:
WIP: Add a test for detach/attach root volume

This adds a compute API test for testing the detach and attach of root
volume for instance in shelved_offloaded state.

The Nova change allows to detach the root volume from a shelved offloaded
instance, the tempest test is testing the following path:
- boot an instance from volume
- shelve the instance
- verify that the detach of the root volume works
- verify that the unshelve of the instance fails as the instance doesn't
  have a root volume
- attach the root volume
- verify that the unshelve of the instance works correctly.

Since the os-volume_attachments API response schema changed in 2.72 the
2.72 response schema changes are added:

- attach volume response includes boot_index
- show volume attachment response includes boot_index and volumeId
  can be null if the root volume is detached
- list volume attachments response includes boot_index and volumeId
  can be null if the root volume is detached

The 2.71 servers schema is also back-filled for the same related
volume attachment API schema changes to be used in 2.72.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/623981/

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Iab442d2f180b6bc6b584e9e5c6fb1433399343df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/50/332050/24 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from tempest.lib import exceptions as lib_exc class DetachAttachBootVolumeShelveTestJSON(AttachVolumeTestJSON): """Testing attach and detach bootable volume with shelved offloaded instance. This test checks the attaching and detaching bootable volumes from a shelved or shelved offloaded instance booted from a volume. """ min_microversion = '2.31' max_microversion = 'latest' def __init__(self): super(DetachAttachBootVolumeShelveTestJSON, self).__init__() def _shelve_server(self): compute.shelve_server(self.servers_client, self.server['id'], force_shelve_offload=True) @test.idempotent_id('0f84f3b3-c190-4cac-909d-3736f3c4d667') @testtools.skipUnless(CONF.validation.run_validation, 'SSH required for this test') @testtools.skipUnless(CONF.compute_feature_enabled.shelve, 'Shelve is not available.') def test_attach_detach_boot_volume(self): # Boot server from volume self.server = self.create_test_server( volume_backed=True, wait_until='ACTIVE') # Get the volume id body = self.servers_client.list_volume_attachments( self.server['id'])['volumeAttachments'] self.assertEqual(1, len(body)) volume_id = body['id'] # Shelve the server self._shelve_server() # Detach Volume and wait that the volume is detached self.servers_client.detach_volume(self.server['id'], volume_id) waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, volume_id, 'available') # Verify that the unshelve is forbidden self.assertRaises(lib_exc.Forbidden, self.servers_client.unshelve_server, self.server['id']) # Attach the volume self.servers_client.attach_volume( self.server['id'], volume_id=volume_id, device=self.server['root_device_name']) waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, self.volume['id'], 'in-use') # Unshelve the instance and verify that it is active self.servers_client.unshelve_server(self.server['id']) waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.servers_client, self.server['id'], 'ACTIVE') # SSH verification self.linux_client = remote_client.RemoteClient( self.get_server_ip(self.server), self.image_ssh_user, self.admin_pass, self.validation_resources['keypair']['private_jey']) self.linux_client.validate_authentication()

commit_message:
Allow password for tempest validation auth_method

This adds 'password' as a valid auth_method for tempest validation
auth_method. The code is already in place for ssh authentication via
password [1] but there was not a corresponding config option.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/2d6bcaa7/tempest/scenario/manager.py#L355-L366

Change-Id: I02cf519230e7ed10387f042903c5a39eb4ac7c97

commit_message:
Adding coverage of account-generator for tag and concurrency parameters

Adding test cases of tempest account-generator on basis of
tag and concurrency parameters used in command.
This patch will check when tag value used is blank
and high concurrency value to ensure the coverage of
tempest account generator.

Change-Id: I6ba477f38b9658f37cf3300955ce5d194fe1525f
Partially-Implements: blueprint tempest-cli-unit-test-coverage
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/24/630024/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
def test_account_generator_no_tag(self): self.opts.tag = "" cp = account_generator.get_credential_provider(self.opts) self.assertEqual('test_creds', cp.name) def test_account_generator_concurrency_high(self): self._setup_test_dirs() _, path = tempfile.mkstemp() self.addCleanup(os.remove, path) self.opts.concurrency = 10000 self.opts.config_file = path self.opts.admin = 'admin' account_file_path = '%s/%s' % (self.directory, self.opts.accounts) account_generaor_object = account_generator.TempestAccountGenerator( app=mock.Mock(), app_args=mock.Mock()) with mock.patch.object(account_generator.config.CONF, 'set_config_path') as print_mock: account_generaor_object.take_action(self.opts) print_mock.assert_called_once_with(self.opts.config_file) self.assertTrue(account_file_path, "No account file found") with open(account_file_path, 'r') as f: data = f.readlines() self.assertEqual(self.opts.accounts, os.path.basename(account_file_path)) self.assertEqual(50000, data.count(' username: fake_user
')) self.assertEqual(50000, data.count(' project_name: fake_project
')) self.assertEqual(50000, data.count(' network: fake_network
')) self.assertEqual(10000, data.count(' - Member
')) self.assertEqual(10000, data.count(' - ResellerAdmin
')) self.assertEqual(10000, data.count(' - admin
')) self.assertEqual(50000, data.count(' resources:
'))

commit_message:
Add a volume extend scenario

It should be possible to extend a Cinder volume even if it has one
or several snapshots. There was once a regression here (see #1470558)

Also, perform additional verification through SSH because in the past
some Cinder drivers didn't do the expected thing. (see #1499452)

Change-Id: I99df7a20271f23e7899a0d0dd93bd995e41bbd0d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/00/249100/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import contextlib import functools from oslo_log import log from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.common import waiters from tempest import config from tempest.scenario import manager from tempest import test CONF = config.CONF LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) # https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1499452 class TestVolumeExtend(manager.ScenarioTest): """This test case attempts to reproduce the following steps: * Create a server, a volume and format the volume * Take a snapshot of the formated volume * Extend the volume * Create two volumes from the snapshot: - One with the same size as the snapshoted volume (before it was extended) - One bigger than the resized volume * Test that all 3 volumes have the expected size and can be mounted (this test that no obvious data corruption happened) """ @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(TestVolumeExtend, cls).skip_checks() if not CONF.volume_feature_enabled.snapshot: raise cls.skipException("Cinder volume snapshots are disabled") @contextlib.contextmanager def _attach_volume(self, server, volume): self.nova_volume_attach(server, volume) try: yield finally: self.nova_volume_detach(server, volume) @contextlib.contextmanager def _attach_and_mount_volume(self, ssh_client, server, volume, device, mount_point): with self._attach_volume(server, volume): ssh_client.exec_command('sudo mkdir ' + mount_point) ssh_client.mount(device, mount_point) try: yield finally: ssh_client.umount(mount_point) @staticmethod def parse_partitions_size(proc_partitions_content): """Parse the content of /proc/partitions and returns partitions size Example of /proc/partitions content: major minor #blocks name 253 0 24576 vda 11 0 418 sr0 253 16 2097152 vdb This should return [24576, 418, 2097152] """ sizes = [] for partition in proc_partitions_content.split('\n'): fields = partition.split() try: size = int(fields[2]) # Header line doesn't convert to "int" # Also, don't fail on empty/white line except (ValueError, IndexError): continue sizes.append(size) return sizes @test.idempotent_id('ad77fdf2-8f96-11e5-8aa8-9f946ec46bdc') @test.services('compute', 'volume') def test_volume_extend(self): keypair = self.create_keypair() security_group = self._create_security_group() create_kwargs = { 'key_name': keypair['name'], 'security_groups': [{'name': security_group['name']}] } server = self.create_server(create_kwargs=create_kwargs) volume = self.create_volume() # Save the original volume size so that we can create a volume # of this exact size later on. original_vol_size = volume['size'] ssh_client = self.get_remote_client( self.get_server_or_ip(server), private_key=keypair['private_key']) with self._attach_volume(server, volume): ssh_client.make_fs(CONF.compute.volume_device_name) volume_snapshot = self.create_volume_snapshot(volume['id']) extended_volume_size = volume['size'] + 1 self.volumes_client.extend_volume(volume['id'], extended_volume_size) self.volumes_client.wait_for_volume_status(volume['id'], 'available') small_vol_from_snap = self.create_volume( size=original_vol_size, snapshot_id=volume_snapshot['id']) large_vol_from_snap = self.create_volume( size=extended_volume_size + 1, snapshot_id=volume_snapshot['id']) attach_and_mount = functools.partial( self._attach_and_mount_volume, ssh_client, server) with attach_and_mount(volume, 'vdb', '/mnt/1'): with attach_and_mount(small_vol_from_snap, 'vdc', '/mnt/2'): with attach_and_mount(large_vol_from_snap, 'vdd', '/mnt/3'): partitions_size = self.parse_partitions_size( ssh_client.get_partitions()) df_output = ssh_client.exec_command('df -h') # Assert that all partitions have been mounted for i in ['1', '2', '3']: self.assertIn('/mnt/' + i, df_output) # Assert that partitions have the correct size for size in [original_vol_size, extended_volume_size, extended_volume_size + 1]: # Units in /proc/partitions are in KB self.assertIn(int(size) * 1024 ** 2, partitions_size)

commit_message:
Add test az details returns 403

This test makes sure that a GET to compute /os-availability-zone/detail
returns 403 Status Code

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#get-detailed-availability-zone-information

Co-Authored-By: Kurt Garloff <kurt@garloff.de>

Change-Id: Ibe8b300a22e59f905fdd4bb87179651c7b22e76d

commit_message:
Fix of verify_glance_api_versions

verify_glance_api_versions was used
image_v1.ImagesClient().get_versions() method which is work
incorrectly and always return dictionary without versions. As a result
verify_tempest_config disable all image version if could reach v1. Now
it's switched to _get_api_versions method. This should be enough by
https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/image/versions/index.html#api-versions

Also remove meaningless test_verify_glance_version_no_version
verify_glance_api_versions colled only by verify_api_versions which
take services from endpoints list. So if image service present in
endpoints list but have no versions such configuration is broken and
we should not workaroud it by desabling service in config.

Change-Id: I43e03a272d8c71671c2eaf78e621c03a2eec6866
Closes-Bug: 1611771

commit_message:
Fix the bug of test_list_images_filter_by_changes_since

After creating a new image, the image is not updated.
So it will return a empty sequence or collection.
At last,this issue will fail.

Change-Id: I967bac9cfdf3cc5b5753fa98d7ff113e5f9b4796

commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the
link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I3922c9220c749e252ae0c563c7bc9bd12d5a349d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/16/483816/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: resp = dict((k.lower(), v) for k, v in resp.items())
deleted_lines: resp = dict((k.lower(), v) for k, v in six.iteritems(resp))

commit_message:
Remove deprecated aliases for client managers

The patch aims to remove deprecated aliases for client managers. The
depcreated aliases were used to adapt to different Tempest plugins, and
in Queens it's the time to remove these aliases.

Change-Id: I768dcca98c086c97e9cfd12ec62e6045539ab2a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/22/506422/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # NOTE(jordanP): Tempest should use os_primary, os_admin # and os_alt throughout its code base but we keep the aliases # around for a while for Tempest plugins. Aliases should be # removed eventually. # Setup some common aliases if credentials_type == 'primary': cls.os = debtcollector.moves.moved_read_only_property( 'os', 'os_primary', version='Pike', removal_version='Queens') cls.manager =\ debtcollector.moves.moved_read_only_property( 'manager', 'os_primary', version='Pike', removal_version='Queens') if credentials_type == 'admin': cls.os_adm = debtcollector.moves.moved_read_only_property( 'os_adm', 'os_admin', version='Pike', removal_version='Queens') cls.admin_manager =\ debtcollector.moves.moved_read_only_property( 'admin_manager', 'os_admin', version='Pike', removal_version='Queens') if credentials_type == 'alt': cls.alt_manager =\ debtcollector.moves.moved_read_only_property( 'alt_manager', 'os_alt', version='Pike', removal_version='Queens')

commit_message:
Replace six.itervalues with dict.values()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3#Common_patterns

[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Co-authored-By: Dai Dang Van <daidv@vn.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I6c210926a2d8d5d91c4428b72121cef1aaf4871f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/92/485492/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: resp = dict((k.lower(), v) for k, v in resp.items())
deleted_lines: resp = dict((k.lower(), v) for k, v in six.iteritems(resp))

commit_message:
Specify the user_id query parameter

We can revert the quotas to default values for a project or
a project and a user. This patch adds reverting quotas for a
project and a user, specify the user_id query parameter in
delete_quota_set.

And also, in order to avoid duplicated code, I combine update_
quotas testcase and delete_quotas testcase.

Change-Id: Ia6b73473d0804ccc84be3bcbb80f25b3bbd72d99

commit_message:
Add firewall policy client

Firewall policy client is necessary to test the firewall.
the following client methods are now available for Tempest:
* create_firewall_policy
* update_firewall_policy
* show_firewall_policy
* delete_firewall_policies
* list_firewall_policies

Change-Id: I9f018d504a6bdef797d308242cca047d999e98e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/05/673405/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.lib.services.network import base class FirewallPoliciesClient(base.BaseNetworkClient): def create_firewall_policy(self, **kwargs): """Creates a firewall policy. For a full list of available parameters, please refer to the official API reference: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/index.html#create-firewall-policy """ uri = '/firewall_policies' post_data = {'firewall_policie': kwargs} return self.create_resource(uri, post_data) def update_firewall_policy(self, firewall_policy_id, **kwargs): """Updates a firewall policy. For a full list of available parameters, please refer to the official API reference: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/index.html#update-firewall-policy """ uri = '/firewall_policies/%s' % firewall_policy_id post_data = {'firewall_policie': kwargs} return self.update_resource(uri, post_data) def show_firewall_policy(self, firewall_policy_id, **fields): """Shows details for a firewall policy. For a full list of available parameters, please refer to the official API reference: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/index.html#show-firewall-policy-details """ uri = '/firewall_policies/%s' % firewall_policy_id return self.show_resource(uri, **fields) def delete_firewall_policies(self, firewall_policy_id): uri = '/firewall_policies/%s' % firewall_policy_id return self.delete_resource(uri) def list_firewall_policies(self, **filters): """Lists firewall policies. For a full list of available parameters, please refer to the official API reference: http://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/networking/v2/index.html#list-firewall-policies """ uri = '/firewall_policies' return self.list_resources(uri, **filters)

commit_message:
Add choice to set group spec for group tests

Group related test cases will fail if group spec is null and
there is group type specs checking during group creating in
storage driver. Add choice to allow vendor to set spec in
tempest.conf when runing tempest.

Change-Id: I786cdb1688ab5d63973b4626e871674b3981b8e2
Closes-bug:1745307

commit_message:
Add concurrency based tests for tempest run

There were no test cases exist in tempest run for
it's concurrency parameter.
This Patch will add the tests from both positive and negative
perspective of tempest run for concurrency parameter.

Change-Id: I0067eb969cc35c5737e7ee09e743655029218f76
Partially-Implements: blueprint tempest-cli-unit-test-coverage

commit_message:
docs: Use sphinx-apidoc library for autodoc generation

This package is used for automatic generation of autodoc
documentation which offers the following advantages:

* the Tempest framework for all modules is always built
  and kept up to date
* it is isolated in its own page layout
* it can still be linked to by other documentation pages
  easily
* the Tempest classes or modules can be linked by other
  projects

build_redirect function makes it possible to generate html
files with a redirect in case of moving or deleting pages.

Change-Id: I9a843ea024e71fbb377de5aa57cedafdd456269d

This patch sets the failing lower-constraints job to non-voting until
final fix arrives for the failure.

With the latest setuptools (bundled into python virtualenv) the lower
constraints job started to fail on ussuri when it tries to install old
version of 'decorator'. The error message is:

  error in decorator setup command: use_2to3 is invalid.

The needed minimal version of 'decorator' would be 4.0.0, but it is

On old branches it would be good to pin setuptools (virtualenv),

  * I4b2d321b7243ec149e9445035d1feb7a425e9a4b (Skip to run all

Change-Id: I01700882ca63f26975d4ecfd7d0a90ea95fe6614

commit_message:
[stable-only] Set lower-constraints job as non-voting

This patch sets the failing lower-constraints job to non-voting until
final fix arrives for the failure.

With the latest setuptools (bundled into python virtualenv) the lower
constraints job started to fail on ussuri when it tries to install old
version of 'decorator'. The error message is:

  error in decorator setup command: use_2to3 is invalid.

The needed minimal version of 'decorator' would be 4.0.0, but it is
only needed if the latest version of setuptools (virtualenv) is used.
On old branches it would be good to pin setuptools (virtualenv),
otherwise we can face similar issues. Until the final decision / fix,
let's just set the lower-constraints job non-voting to unblock the
gate.

Conflicts:
  .zuul.yaml

NOTE(melwitt): The conflicts are because of job template name
difference (openstack-python3-ussuri-jobs vs
openstack-python3-train-jobs) and because the following changes are
not in Train:

  * Ie1a0cbd82a617dbcc15729647218ac3e9cd0e5a9 (Stop testing Python 2)
  * I4b2d321b7243ec149e9445035d1feb7a425e9a4b (Skip to run all
    integration jobs for policy-only changes.)

Change-Id: I01700882ca63f26975d4ecfd7d0a90ea95fe6614
(cherry picked from commit 5ded5d8050c98f3e2ec61b340171d2a56735c2eb)

commit_message:
[stable-only] Pin virtualenv and setuptools

Setuptools 58.0 (bundled in virtualenv 20.8) breaks the installation of
decorator 3.4.0. So this patch pins virtualenv to avoid the break.

As the used 'require' feature was introduced in tox in version 3.2 [1],
the required minversion has to be bumped, too.

[1] https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-requires

Change-Id: I26b2a14e0b91c0ab77299c3e4fbed5f7916fe8cf

commit_message:
Add ability to noop a service

We want also be able to noop_resource('service'). In order to do that we
also add stubs for status, start and stop. Without this it fails with:
[root@controller-0 openstack-puppet]# NET_HOST=true DEBUG=True PROCESS_COUNT=1 CONFIG=/root/bandini.json python3 /var/lib/container-puppet/container-puppet.py 2>&1 | tee /tmp/puppet.log |grep Error:
<13>Oct  4 10:28:26 puppet-user: Error: /Service[rsyncd]: Could not evaluate: undefined method `status' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop
<13>Oct  4 10:28:26 puppet-user: Error: /Service[rsyncd]: Failed to call refresh: undefined method `status' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop
<13>Oct  4 10:28:26 puppet-user: Error: /Service[rsyncd]: undefined method `status' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop
<13>Oct  4 10:28:26 puppet-user: Error: /Service[rsyncd]: Could not evaluate: undefined method `status' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop
<13>Oct  4 10:28:26 puppet-user: Error: /Service[rsyncd]: Failed to call refresh: undefined method `status' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop
<13>Oct  4 10:28:26 puppet-user: Error: /Service[rsyncd]: undefined method `status' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop
[root@controller-0 openstack-puppet]# NET_HOST=true DEBUG=True PROCESS_COUNT=1 CONFIG=/root/bandini.json python3 /var/lib/container-puppet/container-puppet.py 2>&1 | tee /tmp/puppet.log |grep Error:
<13>Oct  4 10:29:03 puppet-user: Error: Could not set 'running' on ensure: undefined method `start' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop
<13>Oct  4 10:29:03 puppet-user: Error: Could not set 'running' on ensure: undefined method `start' for Service[rsyncd](provider=noop):Puppet::Type::Service::ProviderNoop

Related-Bug: #1945962

Change-Id: I9ee8108fe749e787b82f8f4c226f44685ab21a99
(cherry picked from commit 8e6e49d28d4db79745371f737a16731f2faad00b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/89/812389/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def status 0 end def start true end def stop true end

commit_message:
Remove devstack bindep packages for building disk images

Disk image building has been moved to ironic-python-agent-builder,
and dependencies should no longer need to be managed inside the
ironic project.

Change-Id: I475361501cc5c3c9d03ce9dd21d2a3bf6e96de8a

commit_message:
Ensure certificate installation path exists

Currently we assume that destination directory for certificates
isntallation would be created by the role which includes PKI
however it's not always the case.

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server/+/807717
Change-Id: Iec4ed507d1475f784d9c25d9b6153f8447f831ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ansible-role-pki refs/changes/71/807771/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Create certificate destination directories file: path: "{{ item.dest | dirname }}" state: directory mode: "0755" loop: "{{ pki_install_certificates | default([]) }}" mode: "{{ install.item.mode | default('0644') }}"

commit_message:
[ceph-provisioner] Add support to connect to rook-ceph cluster

This is to add support for rook-ceph in provisioner chart so that
if any clients want to connect can  make use of it .

Change-Id: I26c28fac3fa0f5d0b0e71a288217b37a5ca8fb13
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-helm-infra refs/changes/91/811791/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {{- if eq .Values.ext_ceph_cluster.rook_ceph.connect true }} - name: CONNECT_TO_ROOK_CEPH_CLUSTER value: "true" {{- end }}

Refactor Charm Guide

Refactor the charm guide to have a Diataxis framework alignment. This
organizes the set of documentation into a variety of categories such as
getting started, how-tos, concepts, and reference material.

commit_message:
Test bundles for focal-wallaby and hirsute-wallaby

These are the test bundles (and any associated changes) for
focal-wallaby and hirsute-wallaby support.

Libraries sync.

hisute-wallaby test is disabled (moved to dev) due to [1] as bundle may
reference a reactive charm.

[1] https://github.com/juju-solutions/layer-basic/issues/194

Change-Id: I07a7c57f55822d3fa0e24133cf6e166d12945ebe
Co-authored-by: Aurelien Lourot <aurelien.lourot@canonical.com>

'0' - '1' - '2' rabbitmq-server: charm: cs:~openstack-charmers-next/rabbitmq-server num_units: 1 options: source: *openstack-origin to: - '3' neutron-api: charm: cs:~openstack-charmers-next/neutron-api series: *series num_units: 1 options: manage-neutron-plugin-legacy-mode: true overlay-network-type: 'vxlan' l2-population: True flat-network-providers: physnet1 neutron-security-groups: true openstack-origin: *openstack-origin enable-dvr: True to: - '4' keystone: charm: cs:~openstack-charmers-next/keystone num_units: 1 options: openstack-origin: *openstack-origin to: - '5' glance: charm: cs:~openstack-charmers-next/glance num_units: 1 options: openstack-origin: *openstack-origin to: - '6' neutron-openvswitch: charm: ../../../neutron-openvswitch options: use-dvr-snat: True bridge-mappings: physnet1:br-ex enable-local-dhcp-and-metadata: True nova-cloud-controller: charm: cs:~openstack-charmers-next/nova-cloud-controller num_units: 1 options: network-manager: Neutron openstack-origin: *openstack-origin to: - '7' nova-compute: charm: cs:~openstack-charmers-next/nova-compute num_units: 2 options: config-flags: default_ephemeral_format=ext4 enable-live-migration: true enable-resize: true migration-auth-type: ssh openstack-origin: *openstack-origin to: - Manila: Hide password strings

This change ensures that parameters to define password strings are
properly hidden, because the credentials should be secret.

commit_message:
Pass distro to tripleo_container_image_build role

For downstream usecase, we need to properly set distro
flag in "openstack tripleo container image build" command.

By default, If we don't pass --distro flag centos is default[1]

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient/src/branch/master/tripleoclient/v2/tripleo_container_image.py#L107

Closes-Bug: #1945163
Change-Id: I39fed3d952fe2dc1aaf530991c0c26237d043feb

Use kolla_internal_vip_address instead of aio_vip_address

vip_address attribute is now deprecated.

commit_message:
Support configuration of firewalld

Adds support for configuring firewalld for CentOS hosts managed by
Kayobe.

* create zones
* set default zone
* set zone for interfaces
* define rules

Change-Id: Id60e25e129e323f3c07e702bb81a11efc530fb3e
Story: 2008991
Task: 42644
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kayobe refs/changes/68/797068/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- ############################################################################### # Monitoring node firewalld configuration. # Whether to install and enable firewalld. firewalld_enabled: >- {{ controller_firewalld_enabled if inventory_hostname in groups['controllers'] else monitoring_firewalld_enabled }} # A firewalld zone to set as the default. Default is unset, in which case the # default zone will not be changed. firewalld_default_zone: >- {{ controller_firewalld_zone if inventory_hostname in groups['controllers'] else monitoring_firewalld_zone }}" # A list of firewall rules to apply. Each item is a dict containing arguments # to pass to the firewalld module. Arguments are omitted if not provided, with # the following exceptions: # - offline: true # - permanent: true # - state: enabled firewalld_rules: > {{ controller_firewalld_rules if inventory_hostname in groups['controllers'] else monitoring_firewalld_rules }}"

Export Prometheus metrics

This commit export kuryr_cni_requests_duration, kuryr_quota_free_count,
kuryr_port_quota_per_subnet, kuryr_pod_creation_latency metrics to
Prometheus.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/+/811557

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-10-04 07:51:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/test_dvr_router.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/framework.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/dvr_edge_router.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/b9143c37e06567b1ce50f9e858c9289984bb8e4b', 'message': '[DVR] Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized

Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized before processing the
IP NAT rules. If the router never had an external GW port, the DVR
GW in the SNAT namespace has not been created and the SNAT iptables
manager has not been initialized.

In this case, the IP NAT rules for centralized FIPs (to be applied
on the SNAT namespace) cannot be set.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/framework.py

Closes-Bug: #1945215
Change-Id: I426602514805d728f8cd78e42f2b0979b2101089
(cherry picked from commit f18edfdf450179f6bc8a47f3b143f2701bd93e0e)
'}]
commit_message:
[DVR] Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized

Check if SNAT iptables manager is initialized before processing the
IP NAT rules. If the router never had an external GW port, the DVR
GW in the SNAT namespace has not been created and the SNAT iptables
manager has not been initialized.

In this case, the IP NAT rules for centralized FIPs (to be applied
on the SNAT namespace) cannot be set.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/l3/framework.py

Closes-Bug: #1945215
Change-Id: I426602514805d728f8cd78e42f2b0979b2101089
(cherry picked from commit f18edfdf450179f6bc8a47f3b143f2701bd93e0e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/85/812285/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not self.snat_iptables_manager: LOG.debug("DVR router: no snat rules to be handled") else: self.process_floating_ip_nat_rules_for_centralized_floatingip()

commit_message:
Remove --no-workflow option

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I44437cff96fd51f70028315cdf3840abbbc08451

commit_message:
Drop constrain of versions <0.8 for PrettyTable.

We had restricted version for <0.8 and >0.7.2 (which is 8 years old
btw), which probably breaks the interface, although current version,
which is 2.2.1 works just fine with kuryr-status command. With this
patch, we allow to install latest version, so that it will not break
requirements-check test.

Change-Id: I5542db6829e01b4767fe1df11b421446bc26b6a3

commit_message:
Try deinit odl_features in TestOdlFeaturesNoFixture setUpClass

test_feature_configs_does_not_mutate_default_features sporadically fails
with the following:
testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: {} !=
{'operational-port-status': '', 'bgpvpn-vni': ''}
This patch runs odl_features.deinit at the beginning of the test to run
it on a clean beases.

Change-Id: I2185c30f260f95ef2e0b90c14399260702837f29
Closes-Bug: #1835216
(cherry picked from commit ef695842c97236d8eba23ffe883f6cead7a153dc)

commit_message:
Add client and member listener timeouts for persistence (Ex. SSH)

Add possibility to specify connection timeouts for SSH listeners.
These values are available in openstacksdk:
https://github.com/openstack/openstacksdk/blob/95ee95f52c28ee4647886dbb702e0a1015c88604/openstack/load_balancer/v2/listener.py#L89

Change-Id: Ief1abd9018bb6dab73702cc416e5a916f8baa0d7

- update tox/pip.sh to ensure setuptools<50.0.0

This optional kwarg to the nova.volume.cinder.API.attachment_update
method ends up stashed in the connector passed to c-api and sets the
device associated with the attachment within Cinder. While this being
unset has no real world impact it should be kept the same as the
original attachment for completeness.

The Cinder fixture is extended to mimic the behaviour of
nova.volume.cinder.API.attachment_update prior to calling Cinder
allowing us to assert the value stashed in the connector and attachment
record.

Closes-Bug: #1945450
Change-Id: Ib2938a407598bf2dd466aae41700f350d2d34418
'}]
commit_message:
nova-manage: Ensure mountpoint is passed when updating attachment

This optional kwarg to the nova.volume.cinder.API.attachment_update
method ends up stashed in the connector passed to c-api and sets the
device associated with the attachment within Cinder. While this being
unset has no real world impact it should be kept the same as the
original attachment for completeness.

The Cinder fixture is extended to mimic the behaviour of
nova.volume.cinder.API.attachment_update prior to calling Cinder
allowing us to assert the value stashed in the connector and attachment
record.

Closes-Bug: #1945450
Change-Id: Ib2938a407598bf2dd466aae41700f350d2d34418

commit_message:
Enable CSRF token handling for swift dashboard

Swift dashboard uses DELETE request, which is not covered by current CSRF
token injection method. Also, CSRF token is not passed through HTTP at
this dashboard, so CSRF_COOKIE_HTTPONLY option breaks the dashboard
operation. Proposed patch fixes both issues

Closes-Bug: #1943618
Change-Id: If6a20bc363fe72f0693c008c79af76143344aec8

commit_message:
Add xena bundles

- add non-voting focal-xena bundle
- add non-voting impish-xena bundle
- remove groovy-victoria bundle
- charm-helpers sync for new charm-helpers changes
- update tox/pip.sh to ensure setuptools<50.0.0

Change-Id: I9c9d72d83b9c14dafef98a3fe9bb84e2b6cfbe1f

commit_message:
WIP: Include more information in policy debug logging

You get about half of what you need to debug authorization decisions
when you set oslo.policy to DEBUG. It would be nice to know the result
and the actual check string in addition to the rule, credentials, and
target.

Attempt to make that change here.

Change-Id: I161e61987e5c02af940bf90b843e9c744c6da7b3

commit_message:
image_uploader: Excluding schemaVersion 1 from copy_registry_to_registry

When media_type is None, that probably means that we're handling a
schemaVersion 1 and there's no config manifest. We shouldn't go through
this code path when there's no media_type.

Change-Id: I6bb5b16c43bf4f825a3832eb017f76c43215b7dc

commit_message:
Allow for OCI manifests

We always convert to docker metadata for the undercloud, but we need to
be able to handle OCI source manifests from a remote registry.  We
previously added support to handle the conversion however it wasn't
complete since we only request docker manifests from remote registries.

Change-Id: I3ca3d7c08d08525ead15c50d2e44c9db310859e7
Related-Bug: #1860585

commit_message:
Migrate from testr to stestr

Note that the interface doesn't actually have tests.  This is just to
migrate away from the deprecated testr module.
Add .zuul.yaml so that the project can be merged

commit_message:
Do not merge: Debugging https://pad.lv/1933966

Test the gate with minimal mirrors dropped from the gss mirror_list
in the test bundles. More about this at:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-glance-simplestreams-sync/+bug/1933966/comments/4

This also includes the changes from:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-octavia-diskimage-retrofit/+/811211
to ensure pip changes are in place.

Change-Id: I62e82d28c5548beca227164b12a6eff00d63251a

commit_message:
Update sriov config service to handle nic partitioned PF

Create VFs using udev rules are required for attaching
and removing PF from a VM. On a reboot, when udev rules
trigger VF creation script and when a VF is attached to
vfio-pci driver, some of the VFs on that PF are not
initialized properly, resulting in VF not found issue.
Though it looks like driver issue, this patch avoids
this scenarios by removing the nic-paritioned VF from
the udev rule, as when one of the VF is attached to host,
the PF cannot be used by the VM.

Change-Id: Ic6738de42b9aa0346f48060c143c5f779b67867e
(cherry picked from commit fcf3d9cd126f30ecfe166aa5271a2f212a51a5a6)

The function setUp_pf_stubs() was added in the vdpa patch:
    https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/os-net-config/+/798926/
Since there is a dependency on this API for the tests of this patch,
it has been added here

Change-Id: I2738765f2fdb1bf0e88eccbce345f677b82116fe
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-net-config refs/changes/02/812502/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def is_partitioned_pf(dev_name: str) -> bool: """Check if any nic-partition(VF) is already used Given a PF device, returns True if any VFs of this device are in-use. """ sriov_map = _get_sriov_map() for config in sriov_map: devtype = config.get('device_type', None) if devtype == 'vf': name = config.get('device', {}).get('name') vf_name = config.get('name') if dev_name == name: logger.warning("%s has VF(%s) used by host" % (name, vf_name)) return True return False if not is_partitioned_pf(item['name']): add_udev_rule_for_legacy_sriov_pf(item['name'], item['numvfs'])

commit_message:
Add Snapshot Attachment For MacroSAN

Add support for the 'snapshot attach' feature of MacroSAN driver

Change-Id: I10aced5345b34a1c4f1fad5d65f713f1d1ce6390
Implements: blueprint macrosan-snapshot-attach

subject: Enable consistent network device naming
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-07-07 15:34:17.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/d819a4b8fefb4a14a668de016a3cfe81925725d7', 'message': 'Enable consistent network device naming

CentOS cloud images come with net.ifnames=0 on the kernel command line,
which disables consistent network device naming. This does not provide a
good experience on bare metal because NIC ordering can vary.

Set net.ifnames=1 in the DIB default environment to restore consistent
network device naming.

Change-Id: I20465eab4e0aec6620578a92d3bdbddcec0954df
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2021-07-07 21:16:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/4773e8931456b6fdcfffd2d37c41686c30a56709', 'message': 'Enable consistent network device naming

CentOS cloud images come with net.ifnames=0 on the kernel command line,
which disables consistent network device naming. This does not provide a
good experience on bare metal because NIC ordering can vary.

Set net.ifnames=1 in the DIB default environment to restore consistent
network device naming. The parameters `nofb nomodeset gfxpayload=text`
are also set to preserve defaults from DIB.

Change-Id: I20465eab4e0aec6620578a92d3bdbddcec0954df
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2021-07-23 12:08:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kayobe/commit/4a06b6ed5577f1ab95970cf88bfa63d44126cf24', 'message': 'Enable consistent network device naming

CentOS cloud images come with net.ifnames=0 on the kernel command line,
which disables consistent network device naming. This does not provide a
good experience on bare metal because NIC ordering can vary.

Set net.ifnames=1 in the DIB default environment to restore consistent
network device naming. The parameters `nofb nomodeset gfxpayload=text`
are also set to preserve defaults from DIB.

Change-Id: I20465eab4e0aec6620578a92d3bdbddcec0954df

which disables consistent network device naming. This does not provide a
good experience on bare metal because NIC ordering can vary. This is
specific to cloud images: an ISO installation would use consistent
network device naming.

We now set net.ifnames=1 in the DIB default environment to use
consistent network device naming. The parameters `nofb nomodeset
gfxpayload=text` are also set to preserve defaults from DIB.

To restore the existing behaviour, set DIB_BOOTLOADER_DEFAULT_CMDLINE to
`nofb nomodeset gfxpayload=text net.ifnames=0` in the
kolla_bifrost_dib_env_vars_extra dictionary.

Change-Id: I20465eab4e0aec6620578a92d3bdbddcec0954df
'}]
commit_message:
Enable consistent network device naming

CentOS cloud images come with net.ifnames=0 on the kernel command line,
which disables consistent network device naming. This does not provide a
good experience on bare metal because NIC ordering can vary. This is
specific to cloud images: an ISO installation would use consistent
network device naming.

We now set net.ifnames=1 in the DIB default environment to use
consistent network device naming. The parameters `nofb nomodeset
gfxpayload=text` are also set to preserve defaults from DIB.

To restore the existing behaviour, set DIB_BOOTLOADER_DEFAULT_CMDLINE to
`nofb nomodeset gfxpayload=text net.ifnames=0` in the
kolla_bifrost_dib_env_vars_extra dictionary.

Change-Id: I20465eab4e0aec6620578a92d3bdbddcec0954df

commit_message:
Check for passwords at old path during tripleo deploy

Commit ecafbae4ee7c403a3ef62e362c261585aabbec5c updated tripleo deploy
to use a different working directory. That broke upgrades because the
passwords file was still at the old path, and the passwords can not
change during a tripleo deploy upgrade. This patch checks the old
location for a passwords file, and if present, migrates it to the new
location.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I547ba1a7409290f4888e53dd45a883c263f0670f

commit_message:
Automate the /var/lib/ceph backup during recovery phase

To keep strong consistency for Ceph when Ceph nodes are collocated with
controllers, it is necessary to take a backup of the /var/lib/ceph
directory just before doing a recovery, restore the ReaR backup and then
extract the /var/lib/ceph backup over the (old) ceph data that is
outdated. With this simple action, the information lost is almost none.

This change creates two new scripts that are executed by ReaR during
restore that do exactly what is needed, eliminating the need for doing
it by hand.

Change-Id: Ib7c699b737980c5495cce2cf42f5847fda0f72f5
(cherry picked from commit 288233da8cbbad3af374a75db4ba53096823822d)

added_lines: - name: Is this machine a ceph node? stat: path: /var/lib/ceph register: varlibceph_dir tags: - bar_setup_rear - name: Get the directory where /var/lib/ceph is mounted on shell: | set -o pipefail df /var/lib/ceph | grep -v Filesystem | awk '{print $6}' register: tripleo_backup_and_restore_ceph_dir when: varlibceph_dir.stat.exists tags: - bar_setup_rear - name: Get the device where /var/lib/ceph is mounted on shell: | set -o pipefail df /var/lib/ceph | grep -v Filesystem | awk '{print $1}' register: tripleo_backup_and_restore_ceph_device when: varlibceph_dir.stat.exists tags: - bar_setup_rear - name: Get the filesystem format of the device where /var/lib/ceph is mounted on shell: | set -o pipefail grep {{ tripleo_backup_and_restore_ceph_device.stdout }} /etc/mtab | grep '{{ tripleo_backup_and_restore_ceph_dir.stdout }} ' | awk '{print $3}' register: tripleo_backup_and_restore_ceph_device_format when: varlibceph_dir.stat.exists tags: - bar_setup_rear - name: Program a script that will trigger during restore backuping /var/lib/ceph if it exists just before restore copy: dest: /usr/share/rear/setup/default/011_backup_ceph.sh content: | echo "Taking a fresh ceph data backup if this controller has co-located cephs" mount -t {{ tripleo_backup_and_restore_ceph_device_format.stdout }} {{ tripleo_backup_and_restore_ceph_device.stdout }} /mnt/local cd /mnt/local [ -d "var/lib/ceph" ] && tar cvfz /tmp/ceph.tar.gz var/lib/ceph --xattrs --xattrs-include='*.*' --acls cd / umount {{ tripleo_backup_and_restore_ceph_device.stdout }} when: varlibceph_dir.stat.exists tags: - bar_setup_rear - name: Program a script that will trigger during restoration to restore /var/lib/ceph backup after a full recovery copy: dest: /usr/share/rear/wrapup/default/501_restore_ceph.sh content: | echo "Restoring ceph backup if it exists" if [ -f "/tmp/ceph.tar.gz" ]; then rm -rf /mnt/local/var/lib/ceph/* tar xvC /mnt/local -f /tmp/ceph.tar.gz var/lib/ceph --xattrs --xattrs-include='*.*' fi when: varlibceph_dir.stat.exists tags: - bar_setup_rear

commit_message:
Make Galera desync operation more resilient

Sometimes, after a hard reboot of a controller node the Galera database
is up&running but not yet able to receive requests via the mysql.sock
socket, even if it is already opened. It takes few seconds to get it
working, but during that time, we should keep retrying the desync
operation until it connects to the database.

Closes-Bug: #1945639

Change-Id: I71fe4c14195ebcf11912753425ea15bc679b14f9

commit_message:
Knob to control disruptive changes in systemd units

Global changes in systemd units managed by tripleo cause
recreation of corresponding containers, which disrupts
dataplane. Prohibit such changes by default. That case corresponds
to minor updates or in-place upgrading of existing environments.

For some cases, like FFU, or new deployments, it may (should) be
allowed by users explicitly. New param SystemdDisruptiveChanges
manages that behavior.

Closes-bug: #1945792
Change-Id: I206bb5e6ffad471daafd02e46357d0ffe1d24da1
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/92/811892/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SystemdDisruptiveChanges: default: false description: allow the tripleo_container_manage to issue global modifications in the managed systemd service units, which causes recreation of containers. Not recommended, if there is running workloads. type: boolean - if: - {get_param: SystemdDisruptiveChanges} - - name: Anchor allowance of global containers restarts upon changes in unit files copy: dest: /etc/sysconfig/podman_systemd_anchor content: | This file enables global modifications issued by tripleo_container_manage in the containers systemd service units managed with it. When this file is absent, no such disruptive changes would be let into the unit files. - - name: Prohibit global containers restarts upon changes in unit files file: path: /etc/sysconfig/podman_systemd_anchor state: absent

commit_message:
WIP Fix haproxy default_backend in a couple of services

rabbitmq (mostly unused), redis and haproxy.stats were missing it

Closes-Bug: #1946045
Change-Id: I7a7f253216dd1b95432b21778a6812d762749cf5

Switches to creating a service unit for dnsmasq in order to
facilitate standalone usage and testing of puppet-ironic outside
with Centos-Stream 9 where package changes are anticipated.

This is because the underlying service configuration required does
not require configuration files, and only a unit for the installed
package where the arguments are configured into the systemd launch,
just like how a container would be launched.

'}, {'number': 29, 'created': '2021-08-26 13:55:27.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic/commit/56670c2ff76f3f5a9b0c74ffcc170a9a191f3eb9', 'message': 'Support use of dnsmasq as tftp service

Switches to creating a service unit for dnsmasq in order to
facilitate standalone usage and testing of puppet-ironic outside
with Centos-Stream 9 where package changes are anticipated.

On Centos-Stream 9, users should effectively be forced over to
using dnsmasq automatically, and deployments running on older
versions should see their xinetd configuration disabled by default
with a switch over to using dnsmasq.

The higher level controls for defaults can also be changed for
the purpose of backporting such that prior releases are not
automatically switch to using dnsmasq unless they have to be
run with dnsmasq based upon known package availability.

This is because the underlying service configuration required does
not require configuration files, and only a unit for the installed
package where the arguments are configured into the systemd launch,
just like how a container would be launched in TripleO project
and derivitive works.

Change-Id: I5d388acfb96fa3e3a555a119ff72feabdd1cdf87
'}, {'number': 30, 'created': '2021-08-26 14:13:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic/commit/868a8df205dfe12aef275f2d7dcf60213f6a483b', 'message': 'Support use of dnsmasq as tftp service

Change-Id: I5d388acfb96fa3e3a555a119ff72feabdd1cdf87
'}, {'number': 36, 'created': '2021-09-28 12:48:21.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ironic/commit/02104dbd44e44980d0210808815bdd77a129754e', 'message': "WIP Support use of dnsmasq as tftp service

Switches to using the new ironic-dnsmasq-tftp-server service[1], which
manages the dnsmasq process in order to facilitate standalone usage and
testing of puppet-ironic outside with Centos-Stream 9 where package
changes are anticipated.

On Centos-Stream 9, users should effectively be forced over to using
dnsmasq automatically.

The higher level controls for defaults can also be changed for
the purpose of backporting such that prior releases are not
automatically switch to using dnsmasq unless they have to be run with
dnsmasq based upon known package availability.

Note that just setting tftp_use_xinetd=false in an existing deployment
doesn't remove the xinetd service completely, because of limitation
caused by current implementation of puppet-xinetd, and users are
responsible to remove service, package and etc properly before
switching to the new service.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/ironic-distgit/+/34691

commit_message:
Support use of dnsmasq as tftp service

Switches to using the new ironic-dnsmasq-tftp-server service[1], which
manages the dnsmasq process in order to facilitate standalone usage and
testing of puppet-ironic outside with Centos-Stream 9 where package
changes are anticipated.

On Centos-Stream 9, users should effectively be forced over to using
dnsmasq automatically.

The higher level controls for defaults can also be changed for
the purpose of backporting such that prior releases are not
automatically switch to using dnsmasq unless they have to be run with
dnsmasq based upon known package availability.

Note that just setting tftp_use_xinetd=false in an existing deployment
doesn't remove the xinetd service completely, because of limitation
caused by current implementation of puppet-xinetd, and users are
responsible to remove service, package and etc properly before
switching to the new service.

[1] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/openstack/ironic-distgit/+/34691

Change-Id: I5d388acfb96fa3e3a555a119ff72feabdd1cdf87

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ib5e331ca851474bc4db8287d6a8abaafe75724cd

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/xena

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/xena branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I9c9c2f5f0bec27efe03ba45a27c15b51d69e7dd3

commit_message:
Fix using host_routes in VIP subnet with amphorav2

Ensure that amphorae_network_config parameter is not modified in
AmphoraPostVIPPlug. Modifying it would break amphorav2 persistence by
introducing non-serializable elements in the subnet dict

Story: 2008955
Task: 42580

Change-Id: I8f0d3ba1d083c7e37e7e26617826400a538a0890
(cherry picked from commit 76606b4c4dc9595a015afb4c997f5d02ac7a7343)
(cherry picked from commit 6367a849e9c51dc886bcdc7f99f9ee3f0f7a2516)

commit_message:
Don't use 'requests.PreparedRequest'

We're using 'requests.PreparedRequest' in one place in the tests.
However, the requests docs have a warning that one shouldn't do this:

  Instances are generated from a Request object, and should not be
  instantiated manually; doing so may produce undesirable effects.

It seems we're now seeing just such an effect, as requests has started
attempting to do proxy-related things resulting in the following error:

    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "/usr/lib64/python3.6/unittest/mock.py", line 1183, in patched
    return func(*args, **keywargs)
      File ".../oslo.vmware/oslo_vmware/tests/test_service.py", line 518, in test_send_with_local_file_url
    resp = transport.session.send(request)
      File ".../oslo.vmware/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 636, in send
    kwargs.setdefault('proxies', self.rebuild_proxies(request, self.proxies))
      File ".../oslo.vmware/.tox/py36/lib/python3.6/site-packages/requests/sessions.py", line 301, in rebuild_proxies
    if 'Proxy-Authorization' in headers:
    TypeError: argument of type 'NoneType' is not iterable

Do what we should have done from the beginning and use
'requests.Request.prepare' instead.

[1] https://docs.python-requests.org/en/master/api/#requests.PreparedRequest

Change-Id: I072c64904298cf83cb113e402d85fb62626f39f7
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit e991194cbd82925c8bac43cb979f9262a49850e6)
