commit_message:
Remove dhcp_extra_opt name after first newline character

Passing newline as extra dhcp option name to the DHCP agent causes
issues with configuration of the dnsmasq process for the network.
This patch removes everything what is after first newline character
in the dhcp_extra_opt's name before building dnsmasq's config.

Closes-bug: #1943930
Change-Id: Iab2832e750ff5ef09c5dcacae4dbff4f9e62bc2d
(cherry picked from commit 5abd1fb61018e497b369712a0952bb1a18022142)

commit_message:
Add support for invalid version documents

Older versions of placement didn't include the status field in their
version discovery documents. This was fixed in placement in [1] but
there are clouds out there in the wild running this version and it's not
possible to use keystoneauth to talk to them. Resolve this by allowing
us to continue functioning in the absence of this field.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/575117

Change-Id: I988df57271b57af60fd191b340a8bc735a4549bc
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystoneauth refs/changes/37/751237/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Drop +2/-2 Backport-Candidate label values for oslo

This distinction is unnecessary. Only allow cores to make the
determination on whether a patch is a backport candidate or not. There's
nothing stopping anyone else from deciding to do the backport even
without the label if they think it's necessary.

Change-Id: Ic6233d2219c31ec52333c1a22a06a7910d4b3b86
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
docs: Add a guide on overcommit

Our documentation for how to configure overcommit ratios, along with the
implications of same, is limited. Address this.

Change-Id: Ia6f696e1d2f68e0756753c08b0f11dec878229ee
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove unreachable codepaths

'ResourceTracker.pci_tracker' is always set in '_init_compute_node',
which is called from 'update_available_resource' (via
'_update_available_resource'). This function is, in turn, always called
in 'ComputeNode._update_available_resource_for_node', which is in turn
called by 'pre_start_hook' (via 'update_available_resource'). There's no
reason to handle it not being set.

We do need to set it manually in the unit tests to work around the fact
they're not initializing everything correctly. This was being done
previously but it now centralized.

Change-Id: I95c7d025c31b372ed441c438a2836043fc135b59
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
WIP: Group IPs by network UUID, not network names

Multiple '/server' APIs include details about the fixed and floating IPs
associated with the instance. Previously, these were grouped by network
name. This was problematic when networks shared the same name, since we
only included the IPs of the first of a possible N network in the
responses. Resolve this by using network UUIDs as the key instead. This
is a change in API behavior so an API microversion is introduced.

Turns out this needs a spec too, so I should re-propose [1]

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/rocky/approved/servers-ips-non-unique-network-names.html

Change-Id: Ia494603479ff5777237382d9d7039ae7f1378f1f
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
Closes-Bug: #1708316

commit_message:
WIP: Add support for translation generation

There are currently a few different ways [1][2] we generated
translations in OpenStack, which involve external scripts that have to
guess what the user intended. Instead of doing this, let's have Sphinx
do the heavy lifting for us. This has a couple of advantages but the
biggest one is that we get this for free, through openstackdoctheme's
use across the OpenStack ecosystem.

This is incomplete: still to do:

- Figure out how things move from 'locale' to 'doc/source/locale' (for
  nova, at least)
- Add generation of an index file
- Make the behavior configurable (off by default) via an environment
  option
- Testing and hardening
- Misc TODOs littered through the code

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/zuul-jobs/blob/2ea7a1b6b/roles/build-releasenotes/tasks/main.yaml#L10
[2] https://github.com/openstack/openstackdocstheme/blob/a0684ace5/bin/docstheme-build-translated.sh

Change-Id: Ia0274e3405e8c44ed87fe669651d2293a5e554be
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstackdocstheme refs/changes/76/624676/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import globfrom sphinx.application import Sphinxfrom sphinx.util.docutils import docutils_namespace from sphinx.util.docutils import patch_docutils_initial_build = Truedef _builder_finished(app, exception): """Generate translations for the given documentation. Hooks into Sphinx's ``builder-finished`` core event and calls Sphinx's ``Application`` class repeatedly to build the required docs. """ global _initial_build if exception or 'html' not in app.builder.name or not _initial_build: return _initial_build = False # extract the various configuration options from the existing builder if 'source' not in app.srcdir or 'build' not in app.outdir: logger.warning('Unexpected directory layout; expected separate ' 'source and build directories but got srcdir=%r, ' 'outdir=%r', app.srcdir, app.outdir) return conf_dir = app.confdir src_dir = app.srcdir # we can be assured that we have separate 'source' and 'build' directories # thanks to the PTI root_dir = os.path.split(app.srcdir.rstrip(os.path.sep))[0] docname = os.path.split(root_dir)[1] keep_going = app.keep_going warning_is_error = app.warningiserror # run 'gettext' builder to generate builders # TODO(stephenfin): Do we need to handle exceptions, app.statuscode? out_dir = os.path.join(root_dir, 'source', 'locale') doctree_dir = os.path.join(root_dir, 'build', 'doctrees.gettext') with patch_docutils(conf_dir), docutils_namespace(): app = Sphinx(src_dir, conf_dir, out_dir, doctree_dir, 'gettext', warningiserror=warning_is_error, keep_going=keep_going) app.build() # generate translations and run 'html' builder for each supported language for locale in filter(lambda x: os.path.isdir(x), os.listdir(out_dir)): if not os.path.exists(os.path.join(locale, 'LC_MESSAGES', docname)): continue language = os.path.basename(locale) logger.info('Building $s translation', language) for pot in glob.glob(os.path.join(out_dir, '*.pot')): resname = os.path.splitext(os.path.basename(pot))[0] # TODO(stephenfin): What should these be called? a = os.path.join(out_dir, language, 'LC_MESSAGES', '%s.po' % resname) b = os.path.join(out_dir, language, 'LC_MESSAGES', '%s.po' % docname) # Merge all translation resources. subprocess.check_call(['msgmerge', '--silent', '-o', a, b, pot]) # Compile all translation resources subprocess.check_call(['msgfmt', '-o', a, b]) out_dir = os.path.join(root_dir, 'build', 'html', language) doctree_dir = os.path.join(root_dir, 'build', 'doctrees.%s' % language) with patch_docutils(conf_dir), docutils_namespace(): app = Sphinx(src_dir, conf_dir, out_dir, doctree_dir, 'html', confoverrides={'language': language}, warningiserror=warning_is_error, keep_going=keep_going) app.build() app.connect('builder-finished', _builder_finished)
